DataElement.preferredName: Dementia Cognitive Abilities Screening Instrument (CASI) Score Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The quantity of Cognitive Abilities Screening Instrument (CASI) scores collected for a participant.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Dementia Cognitive Abilities Screening Instrument (CASI) Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A measure based on a the results of a 25-item screening test used to assess the cognitive capabilities of the participant.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An acquired organic mental disorder with loss of intellectual abilities of sufficient severity to interfere with social or occupational functioning. The dysfunction is multifaceted and involves memory, behavior, personality, judgment, attention, spatial relations, language, abstract thought, and other executive functions. The intellectual decline is usually progressive, and initially spares the level of consciousness.

Concepts.definition: Loss of intellectual abilities interfering with an individual's social and occupational functions. Causes include Alzheimer's disease, brain injuries, brain tumors, and vascular disorders.

Property.preferredDefinition: A 25-item screening test for dementia that provides quantitative assessment on attention, concentration, orientation, short-term memory, long-term memory, language abilities, visual construction, list-generating fluency, abstraction, and judgment.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A 25-item screening test for dementia that provides quantitative assessment on attention, concentration, orientation, short-term memory, long-term memory, language abilities, visual construction, list-generating fluency, abstraction, and judgment.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
